item.description:

item.title: The whole park area, 3rd July
item.description:
I am writing to express my deep concern and utter disappointment regarding the appalling state of Park which my family and I visited on today. What should have been a pleasant evening turned into a distressing and dangerous experience due to the unacceptable level of rubbish and hazardous waste present in the park. Most alarming was the presence of broken glass, which caused a painful injury to my child. We had to administer first aid and seek further treatment due to deep cuts sustained while playing on what should have been a safe and well-maintained public space. Even more shocking, I discovered used needles scattered around the park. I personally collected and safely disposed of them at our local pharmacy, as I could not risk leaving them where other children might come across them. This is completely unacceptable in any public area, let alone one frequented by families. I demand to know what immediate actions are being taken to address this serious public safety hazard. This level of neglect poses not only a risk to public health but shows a grave failure in maintenance and oversight. It is the responsibility of the council to ensure that public spaces are safe and clean for all residents. I expect a prompt response, a formal investigation, and details of the measures being put in place to ensure this does not happen again. I would also like to know how often the park is currently being cleaned and patrolled. This issue must be treated with the urgency and seriousness it demands before more injuries—or worse—occur

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kimberley Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus Lane Markings not visible., 3rd July
item.description:
Hello, I’m a Bus Driver and the Bus Lane Markings have faded as you go down Denmark Hill between the Hospital and Camberwell Green. Please can they be repainted?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Denmark Hill, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Marsh and Parsons 91 Salusbury road, 3rd July
item.description:
This area is used daily by people drinking and smoking. The council have told me that Veolia is meant to sweep a few meters into side streets daily but they are clearly not doing so. The result is an unsanitary collection of cigarette butts, leaves and empty bottles. Please sweet this area and keep it cleaner. Many thanks.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hartland Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
